C#, Decode

How to Decode a Base64 Encoded String in C# – Definitive Guide

Published on: January 21, 2023January 21, 2023 | Last updated on: January 21, 2023 | by: Vikram Aruchamy

Base64 strings are used to represent binary data in a textual format.

You can decode a Base64 encoded string in C# using System.Convert.FromBase64String(base64String) method.

Basic Example

String base64String = "SGVsbG8gd29ybGQh";

byte[] data = System.Convert.FromBase64String(base64String);

string decodedString = System.Text.Encoding.ASCII.GetString(data);

Console.WriteLine(decodedString); //Hello world!

This tutorial explains how to decode a Base64 Encoded String in C# and how to handle URL-encoded Base64 strings.

Table of Contents

  • Using FromBase64String Method
  • URL Safe Decoding from Base64
  • Additional Resources

Using FromBase64String Method

The FromBase64String() method decodes the base64 encoded string into an 8-bit unsigned integer.

To decode a Base64 encoded string,

  • Get the bytes of the Base64 string using FromBase64String() method
  • Convert the byte array to String using the GetString() method
  • You’ll get the ASCII string equivalent of your Base64 String

Namespaces

using System;

Code

The following code demonstrates how to use the FromBase64String() method.

  • The string is converted to bytes using ASCII encoding. Alternatively, you can use UTF8 encoding based on your string representation
String base64String = "SGVsbG8gd29ybGQh";

byte[] data = System.Convert.FromBase64String(base64String);

string decodedString = System.Text.Encoding.ASCII.GetString(data);

Console.WriteLine(decodedString); //Hello world!

URL Safe Decoding from Base64

Sometimes a URL might be converted into a Base64 format. Before converting, the URL will be URL-encoded to replace characters such as = with %3D. Because the = character is reserved for padding in the Base64 format.

In such cases, after decoding the string, you need to URL decode to find the actual URL.

To safely decode the Base64 encoded URLs,

  • Get the byte array using the FromBase64String() method
  • Convert the Byte array to string format using the GetString() method
  • With this, you’ll have a URL string with special characters = represented as %3d
  • Decode this string using the UrlDecode() method
  • You’ll get the actual URL string as output

The following code demonstrates how to decode the Base64 URLs.

Namespaces

using System;
using System.Net;
using System.Web;

Code

String base64String = "aHR0cHMlM2ElMmYlMmZ3d3cuYmFzZTY0ZGVjb2RlLnBybyUyZiUzZnZhbHVlJTNkMw==";

byte[] data = System.Convert.FromBase64String(base64String);

string decodedString = System.Text.Encoding.UTF8.GetString(data);

Console.WriteLine(decodedString); //https%3a%2f%2fwww.base64decode.pro%2f%3fvalue%3d3

Console.WriteLine(HttpUtility.UrlDecode(decodedString)); //https://www.base64decode.pro/?value=3
